conbody.p: Select the Assignments tab in the remote assignments main window (see ) to create a new assignment.
List of assignments in this tab contains all the unpublished assignments that can still be edited, modified, extended, etc. All these operations are performed in the assignment editing panel.
Elements of the Assignment editing panel:

row.entry: Indicates that this assignment is shared with other teachers in school

conbody.p: Properties tab displays field for entering and editing general information about the assignment: creation date, author, course title, assignment title, description, optional comment, and assignment type.
Files attached to the assignment are displayed in the Content tab.

Tools for adding content files to the assignment are located in the Files to send tab (see ). The tab will be displayed with a red border whenever there are no content files in the assignment, as well as when the total size of the files exceeds cloud quota.
conbody.note: The Files to send tab is displayed only for unpublished assignments.
conbody.p: Press the Create button to start creating a new assignment. An empty template will be presented to you that you can start populating with assignment data. Press Save assignment to save current assignment with any modifications to the cloud. Once the assignment is safely stored in the cloud, it will appear in the list displayed in the upper portion of the window; at this point you can also publish the assignment, i.e. make it available to the students. Press Cancel to cancel creating a new assignments and return to the list of existing assignments.
conbody.note: You can only edit and modify unpublished assignments.

Check the Shared assignment box to make this assignment available for the other teachers in your school. They will be able to import the assignments into their workspace once you save the assignment to the cloud. (see )
conbody.p: Press Publish button to publish the current assignment. This will open publication dialog box (see ).
Press Remove button to initiate the removal of the assignment. You will be prompted for further confirmation of your intentions (see ).

Press Import assignment button to import an assignment previously exported via the Export assignment button. These tools import/export assignments to the local storage, allowing you to store unfinished work locally without uploading it to the cloud or create assignment templates for future reuse.
conbody.note: Only assignment metadata (as displayed in the Properties tab), and content files are saved using the export tool. Use the archive facility (available in the Published assignments tab, see ) to save a published assignment together with student answers, grades, and all the comments.
conbody.p: Press the Import shared assignments to start importing assignments shared by other teachers of your school (see ).
